text: [Music]
hey guys it's Elise and today we're
going back to basics with my perfectly
pipeable buttercream frosting so if you
follow my channel my cupcake addiction
you'll know this one's been on the
channel but it's one of the first
recipes I ever uploaded and I've learnt
so much about frosting since then let's
get started the things that you're gonna
need for your perfectly pipeable
buttercream frosting I've got a spatula
a spoon and I'm just using a cup measure
but you can also use just a small
container I've got a little bit of good
quality vanilla extract I've got some
whole milk I've also got some icing
sugar otherwise known as powdered sugar
or confectioners sugar and that's been
sifted and I'm gonna be mixing all of
that today in a stand mixer with a whisk
attachment but I've tried this with a
paddle attachment I've tried it with a
hand mixer you will need an electric
mixer but any electric mixer will do so
the first thing that you want to do is
you want to take that softened butter
and we're gonna pop it into that mixer
so with your butter it must be softened
when I say softened I don't mean melted
and I also don't mean from the fridge so
just at that room temperature so you can
slide your finger through it no problems
but it's not at all melted we're gonna
whip that on a really high speed for
about 5 minutes
so depending on where you are your
butter could be different colors to
start with ours is quite yellow here in
Australia but I know in the US its white
to begin with if you're in Australia
you're looking for that really nice
lightening in color but anywhere else
you're just giving it exactly five
minutes longer if necessary but not
shorter if you can avoid it so we're
gonna add in some of our powdered sugar
now and I'm just gonna do this about a
cup at a time so the reason that I'm
doing it in such small amounts is so
that I can really give it a good beating
in between each addition pop the mixer
down and just start this one on a really
low speed or you're gonna end up with a
massive cloud of dust you want to give
those about 2 minutes per each addition
so 2 minutes of beating now once it
started to incorporate on the low-speed
turn it right up to high speed 2 minutes
and then we'll add a little bit more
alright so coming back from that one
what you're looking for here is really
nice and white and very smooth looking
buttery sugary mix so just add it
another cup beat it in between and you
want to do that until you've added
almost all of your powdered sugar about
as come to the end of your adding you're
going to notice your buttercream starts
to get a little bit kind of chunky this
is where your milk comes in so first of
all I want you to add in your vanilla
and if you didn't want vanilla
buttercream here if you wanted
strawberry or peppermint or any other
flavor you could just add in your
flavoring essence in place of that
vanilla you're also going to add in a
touch of milk I'm gonna put in about a
teaspoon to begin with so when you're
coming to the perfectly pipeable
buttercream frosting your milk is the
great equalizer this milk is what's
going to give you a firmer frosting or a
smoother frosting now adds up mixing I'm
just keeping my eye on it and I'm going
to add about another teaspoon of milk so
in goes the last of my powdered sugar
and I'm pretty happy with my consistency
at this point but we're gonna give it a
mixture I'm gonna give it my all time
spoon test all right so that's your
frosting complete now in this recipe I
use roughly a tablespoon of that milk
but it's gonna vary depending on your
ingredients where you live and the
temperature of where you're making this
so I always use this spoon test for me I
grab a nice spoon of that beautiful
frosting and if I can shake it and it's
almost falling off but you've really got
to give it a hard shake to move it off
the spoon for me that's the perfectly
pipeable consistency I've made some
things on my channel like buttercream
roses and you'll want that a little bit
firmer so add a bit less milk so use
that milk as your great equalizer
try not to adjust the quantities that
I've left you and all of your
measurements the conversions are in the
description box below but try not to
adjust those because you really need
that ratio of powdered sugar to butter
but if you need smoother frosting or
softer frosting then the milk is gonna
make it softer and if you need firmer
frosting for piping something like say a
buttercream rose then just take a little
bit of that milk out if you want to
color your buttercream frosting you can
do it at this point once it's completely
made that way you can color it in
smaller portions and a gel color or a
paste is best but if you must use liquid
eliminate a little bit of that milk or
make a slightly firmer frosting to begin
with your buttercream frosting is great
at room temperature on the bench for
about three days depending on your
climate so
we climb and it's probably gonna last a
little bit less in the fridge for up to
a week and you can freeze that
absolutely beautifully for up to a month
just bring it back to room temperature
and don't try to defrost it in the
microwave I hope you guys have enjoyed
getting back to basics with me I hope
you'll love mo perfectly pipeable
buttercream frosting as much as I do
make sure you subscribe to my cupcake
addiction if you want to see tons of
ways to use your perfectly pipeable
buttercream frosting and as always guys
thanks very much for watching
[Music]
